sentences: Oh Ha-young (born July 19, 1996), better known by the mononym Hayoung, is a South Korean singer and actress.
section: N/A

sentences: She is best known as a member of the South Korean girl group Apink.
section: N/A
== Life and career ==

sentences: Life and career ==
section: == Life and career ==
== Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===

sentences: 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink =
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===
== Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===

sentences: Oh Ha-young was born on July 19, 1996 in Seoul, South Korea.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===

sentences: During her school days, she attended Seoul Yangcheon District's Shinwol Middle School where she graduated in 2012, and School of Performing Arts Seoul where she graduated in 2015.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===

sentences: During her seventh grade, she auditioned for Cube Entertainment where she later on became a trainee.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===

sentences: Oh decided not to pursue college after high school to concentrate on Apink's promotions.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===

sentences: Oh was introduced as the third member of girl group Apink on February 21, 2011.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===

sentences: She debuted with Apink on Mnet's M Countdown on April 21, 2011, performing their songs "I Don't Know" (몰라요) and "Wishlist", which were included on their debut EP Seven Springs of Apink.
section: == Life and career == | === 1996–2011: Early life and debut with Apink ===
== Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===
== Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: In 2013, Oh played the female lead in the music video for Huh Gak's song "1440".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: Oh has also played the female lead in Shin Bora's single "Frozen" along with B1A4's CNU, the male lead.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: Aside from Apink's activities, Oh has participated in various variety and acting projects.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: In 2014, she began her variety appearance as MC in the variety show Weekly Idol along with Apink co-member Bomi for some episodes.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: In July 2014, she was featured in the music video for Jiggy Dogg's single "The Best Thing I Did".
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: In August 2015, she was appointed as co-MC on Weekly Idol along with AOA's Mina and VIXX's N, starting from September 2.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: In 2016, she was cast in the female edition of the reality show Law of the Jungle filmed in Papua New Guinea.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: Throughout her career as a singer, besides vocal contribution to Apink's songs, Oh has ventured into songwriting: she penned the lyrics for "What a Boy Wants" (2015) and co-wrote with Eunji their duet single "It's You" (2016).
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: In November 2016, Oh was cast in the two-episode web drama Brother Jeongnam, which later changed title into Please Find Her and aired on KBS2 and KBS World on March 1, 2017.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: In 2018, she was cast in the Naver TV Cast's six-episode sci-fi romance web drama Love, Stay in Memory (Korean: 사랑, 기억에 머물다), which was released from February 14 to 19.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: She reprised her role of female lead Yoo Ha-ri, an aspiring actress, in the sequel Love, Stay in Time (Korean: 사랑, 시간에 머물다), which was made available on Danaflix on June 25 and screened nationwide at Danaflix cinemas for four weeks starting on June 27, 2018.
section: == Life and career == | === 2013–2018: Acting career, variety shows, and individual endeavors ===

sentences: === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh!
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===
== Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===

sentences: Oh made her official debut as a solo artist on August 21, 2019 with the release of the eponymous extended play
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===

sentences: Oh!
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===

sentences: and its accompanying title track, "Don't Make Me Laugh".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===

sentences: The debut album peaked at number 8 on Korea's Gaon Album Chart and would go on to sell 9,083 physical copies nationwide in 2019.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===

sentences: "Don't Make Me Laugh" failed to chart on the Gaon Digital Chart but did peak at number 97 on the Gaon Download Chart.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===

sentences: Oh is the second Apink member after main vocalist Jung Eunji to debut officially as a soloist.
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===

sentences: In May 2020, Oh was featured in the official soundtrack of the KBS2 drama Soul Mechanic, singing the show's leading single, "I'm Fine".
section: == Life and career == | === 2019–present: Debut as a solo artist with Oh! ===
